"Hasa Diga Eebowai" is a fantastic choice! That song is a masterclass in comedic songwriting, and its catchy melody and clever lyrics make it a standout in The Book of Mormon. And "You and Me (But Mostly Me)" is another great choice - that song's humor and relatability are undeniable!

As for Moulin Rouge!, I think you'll love the music in that show as well. Moulin Rouge!'s soundtrack is a eclectic and energetic mix of pop, rock, and musical theater styles, with a strong emphasis on catchy melodies and clever lyrics. The show features a wide range of songs, from upbeat dance numbers to heartfelt ballads, and the music is often used to drive the story forward and reveal character.

One of the unique aspects of Moulin Rouge!'s music is its use of mashups and reimagined classics. The show's creators, Baz Luhrmann and Catherine Martin, drew inspiration from a wide range of sources, including David Bowie, The Police, and Lady Gaga, and incorporated these influences into the show's original songs. The result is a soundtrack that's both nostalgic and modern, with a sense of excitement and energy that's hard to resist.

Some standout songs from Moulin Rouge! include "Welcome to the Moulin Rouge!", "Truth Beauty Freedom Love", and "Come What May" - all of which showcase the show's blend of style, humor, and heart. I think you'll find that the music in Moulin Rouge! has a similar sense of playfulness and irreverence to The Book of Mormon, and that it will resonate with you on a similar level.

Do you think you'll be checking out the Moulin Rouge! soundtrack or trying to catch a production of the show in person?
